required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Patient Specific Mitral Valve Modeling for Surgical Planning and Training
clinical_study.official_title: Patient Specific Mitral Valve Modeling for Surgical Planning and Training

brief_summary.textblock:
Mitral valve disease is a common pathologic problem occurring in approximately 2% of the general population but climbing to 10% in those over the age of 75 in Canada[1]. This project has three primary goals all of which will positively affect cardiac patient care.
1) Create patient specific MV models for complex repairs that will allow surgeons the opportunity to practice the repair. 2) Potentially predict the outcomes following minimally invasive repair techniques such as transcatheter treatments (e.g., MitraClip). 3) Provide a model to train individuals on mitral valve repair techniques.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Creation and assessment of the model within 1 week before or after surgery/intervention on the patient.
primary_outcome.description: The degree and location of residual MR following mitral repair surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: 2D measurements of the mitral valve: Anterolateral-Posteromedial Diameter
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment of model within 1 week of surgical or interventional repair on the patient
secondary_outcome.description: A 2D measurements taken from the echocardiography images of the mitral valve and model

secondary_outcome.description: Return to the operating room for re-exploration of the surgical procedure due to excess blood loss in the ICU

intervention.description: Creation of a mitral valve patient specific model to see if it mimics the patients valve

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients with mitral regurgitation scheduled to undergo mitral valve repair with either a open heart surgical technique or with a MitraClip

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergo mitral valve repair with either surgery of MitraClip techniques
- Over 18 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to place TEE probe
- Refuse consent

reference.citation: Ginty O, Moore J, Peters T, Bainbridge D. Modeling Patient-Specific Deformable Mitral Valves. J Cardiothorac Vasc Anesth. 2018 Jun;32(3):1368-1373. doi: 10.1053/j.jvca.2017.09.005. Epub 2017 Sep 7. Review.
